page.title: 06FOLKLORE IN RADSTOCK.
page.content: In Radstock children know rhymes which they use in games.There is Blue Bells Cockleshells Evie Ivie Over,On the Mountain,Under and Over and I am a Little Bumper Car. In our block is a hill called Batson Hill and legend has it that this hill was the hill in a famous nursery rhyme. There was once a quarry and a well at the top of Batson Hill.Years ago people would climb up this hill to fetch their water.Jack and Jill,a married couple went to fetch a pail of water from the well.Then oneday Jack was killed by a falling stone.Jill died of a broken heart and left a son whom the villagers called Jillson,a name which is known today as Gilson.We believe that this is the original Jack and Jill story.
